name: Twenty Minute Buns
author: Debbie
summary: Very quick and simple. Nothing is better than fresh hamburger buns. This is a very sticky dough that requires very little kneading.
directions: In a large mixing bowl, dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water
Let stand until creamy, about 10 minutes
Add oil, 2 cups of flour and the salt; stir well to combine
Add the remaining flour, 1/2 cup at a time, stirring well after each addition
When the dough has pulled together, turn it out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 8 minutes
Lightly oil a large bowl, place the dough in the bowl and turn to coat with oil
Cover with a damp cloth and let rise in a warm place until doubled in volume, about 40 minutes
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and divide into three equal pieces
Divide each big piece into 6 small ones
Place the rounds into the prepared pan
Cover the rolls with a damp cloth  or plastic wrap and let rise until doubled in volume, about 20 minutes
Beat together the egg white and water
Gently brush the risen rolls with the egg wash and then bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 15 minutes or until the rolls are golden brown
